name: The Union Improvement Company, Appellant, v. George B. Markle et al.

judges: Before Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: The Union Improvement Company, Appellant, v. George B. Markle et al.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Green,
For the reasons' stated in the opinion in the case between the same parties, No. 422, January term, 1898, ante, p.'829, the judgment in this case is affirmed.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Green,

attorneys: Richard Q. Hále and John Gr. Johnson, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
The Union Improvement Company, Appellant, v. George B. Markle et al.
Argued March 27, 1899.
Appeal, No. 428, Jan. T., 1898, by plaintiff, from judgment of C. P. No. 4, Phila. Co., Sept. T., 1898, No. 597, on case stated.
Before Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
Thomas Hart, Jr., for appellants.
Richard Q. Hále and John Gr. Johnson, for appellee.
May 8, 1899:
